title: Early Steam Locomotives
text: The first full-scale working railway steam locomotive was built by Richard Trevithick in 1804. It ran on the Penydarren tramroad in Wales. Early designs were heavy and damaged the track.

title: Track Gauge
text: Standard gauge is 1,435 mm (4 ft 8 1‚ÅÑ2 in). It became dominant in Britain and later internationally due to interoperability incentives.

title: Freight Modes
text: Common freight modes include road, rail, maritime, air, and pipelines. Intermodal shipping uses standardized containers moved across multiple modes.

title: Rail Signaling
text: Fixed-block signaling divides track into blocks, authorizing trains to enter only if the block is clear. Moving-block systems use continuous train control to reduce headways.
